intro: Gnidiopsis subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf gnidiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
